gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਸਮੀਪ ਬਸਿ ਬਾਂਸ ਮਹਿਮਾਂ ਨ ਜਾਨੀ ਅਾਨ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਦੂਰ ਭੲੇ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਕੈ ਬੋਹੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Chandan Sameep Basi Baans Mahimaan N Jaanee , Aan Droum Door Bhaay Baasanaa Kai Bohay Hai ?
translation: Just as a bamboo has not known the merits of a sandalwood tree having lived near it, but other trees though far away from it still acquire its fragrance.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਦਰ ਸਰੋਵਰ ਮੈਂ ਜਾਨੈ ਨ ਕਮਲ ਗਤਿ ਮਕਰੰਦ ਕਰਿ ਮਧਕਰ ਹੀ ਬਿਮੋਹੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Daadar Sarovar Main Jaanai N Kamal Gati , Makarand Kari Madhakar Hee Bimohay Hai ?
translation: A frog knows not the goodness of a lotus flower though it stays in the same pond, but bumble bees are crazy of the nectar that is stored in these flowers.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਸਰੀ ਬਿਖੈ ਬਗ ਜਾਨ੍ਰਯੋ ਨ ਮਰਮ ਕਛੂ ਅਾਵਤ ਹੈ ਜਾਤ੍ਰੀ ਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਜਾਤ੍ਰਾ ਹੇਤ ਸੋਹੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Surasaree Bikhai Bag Jaanyo N Maram Kachhoo , Aavat Hai Jaatree Jantr Jaatraa Hayt Sohay Hai ?
translation: An egret living in the waters of river Ganges does not know the importance of that water, but many people come to the river Ganges on a pilgrimage and feel honoured.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਕਟ ਬਸਤ ਮਮ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਹੀਨ ਦੂਰ ਹੀ ਦਿਸੰਤਰ ੳੁਰ ਅੰਤਰ ਲੈ ਪੋਹੇ ਹੈ ॥੬੩੯॥
transliteration: Nikat Basat Mam Gur Oupadays Heena , Door Hee Disantar Ur Antar Lai Pohay Hai ?639?
translation: Similarly, though I live near the True Guru, I am bereft of the knowledge of His advice whereas people from far off places come to the True Guru, obtain His sermon and abides it in their heart. (639)
